Ah.. sorry.. Old patch was applying correctly..

if I were to check out 0.98 and then apply the patch locally and compile everything works fine. The console output says hbase-client has problems in ProtobufUtil finding proto classes and hbase-server has issues as well. But when I do it on my local machine everything works fine.
I get the same behavior. The patch applies and compiles correctly for me. I don't understand what is causing the compilation errors seen by Hadoop QA.

It says


[ERROR] COMPILATION ERROR : 

[INFO] -------------------------------------------------------------

[ERROR] /testptch/hbase/hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/regionserver/ScanQueryMatcher.java:[162,30] error: cannot find symbol

[ERROR]   symbol:   method getColumnFamilyTimeRange()

  location: variable scan of type Scan

/testptch/hbase/hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/regionserver/StoreFileScanner.java:[435,30] error: cannot find symbol

[ERROR]   symbol:   method getColumnFamilyTimeRange()

  location: variable scan of type Scan

/testptch/hbase/hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/regionserver/MemStore.java:[666,30] error: cannot find symbol

yes that is what Hadoop QA says. But if you checkout the 0.98 branch on your local machine and apply HBASE-15130-0.98.v1.patch. It wont give you that error (or any compilation errors). you can do a simple mvn clean install -DskipTests to verify quickly. But the Hadoop QA build gives compilation errors.
May be in build env, some sort of cleanup is not happening and still referring to old jars? Ping Sean Busbey. Any idea boss?

AFAIK, Yetus recognizes "-" and "." as separators for jira-id, branch, and patch iteration. I don't believe it understands '_'.

The build error for module ordering is YETUS-280. you can build with this change in place if you go to the precommit job and use "build with parameters" to check the USE_YETUS_PRERELEASE option.
Sean Busbey ahh okay, I don't have permissions to make configuration parameter changes for the jobs. Would any one of you guys mind kicking off a job on my behalf?
So this appears to be blocked because of the YETUS-280 issue. Can anyone who has permission on Jenkins kick off the build with the option to make Yetus work correctly?

Done! (ref Build #396)

Sorry I missed the earlier comment.
reattaching the v1 patch so that it's newer than the deleted _98 patch. Filed YETUS-298 for treating deleted attachments as viable.

Guess it looks through the history for the last patch. Uploaded the same patch as v1 but now this should be the most recent patch in the history. Sean Busbey can we please kick off a Hadoop QA run again?
Build is now going on #398
Thanks, Sean!
Thanks Sean.

In a review I was told to add fields to query Query.java in a specific manner, the checkstyle from hadoop QA sees this as an issue. I do not believe this is an issue, but will be happy to accommodate Hadoop QA if this feature gets upstream. I can fix the whitespaces and submit another patch. The other issues seem to be compounding and not related to this patch.
Let's make sure the API change in HBASE-15283 is incorporated here also
New patch with the original TimeRange API.
I think now that we have API changes on branch-1 from HBASE-15283 we should incorporate them here. In other words, backport HBASE-14355, then HBASE-15283, then post the combined patch here.

uploaded a new v3 patch. This one is a backport of HBASE-14355 and it incorporates the TimeRange changes from HBASE-15283. Sean Busbey sorry to bug you, but would you mind kicking off a build with the USE_YETUS_PRERELEASE option. I don't have the permissions to do that on jenkins.
Let me test this locally and commit tonight if good. If Sean Busbey has a chance to look at the Jenkins config in the meantime I'll hold off.
sorry was on vacation. build kicked off: https://builds.apache.org/view/PreCommit%20Builds/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/637/
build failed because issue wasn't in PATCH_AVAILABLE. resubmitted
thanks Sean Busbey
Looks good testing locally here, I will commit this tonight unless a build comes back first and indicates something amiss.
